solution_line_template: Writing out the full year uses {num_digits_in_year} numbers so this takes {num_digits_in_year} numbers * {fireworks_per_number} fireworks per number = <<{num_digits_in_year}*{fireworks_per_number}={fireworks_for_year}>>{fireworks_for_year} fireworks.

“HAPPY NEW YEAR” contains {num_letters_in_phrase} letters so this takes {num_letters_in_phrase} letters * {fireworks_per_letter} fireworks per letter = <<{num_letters_in_phrase}*{fireworks_per_letter}={fireworks_for_phrase}>>{fireworks_for_phrase} fireworks.

There is therefore a total of {fireworks_for_year} + {fireworks_for_phrase} = <<{fireworks_for_year}+{fireworks_for_phrase}={initial_fireworks}>>{initial_fireworks} fireworks lit at the start of the display.
From the boxes, they lit another {num_boxes} boxes * {fireworks_per_box} fireworks per box = <<{num_boxes}*{fireworks_per_box}={fireworks_from_boxes}>>{fireworks_from_boxes} fireworks.
So in total, the whole display uses {initial_fireworks} + {fireworks_from_boxes} = <<{initial_fireworks}+{fireworks_from_boxes}={total_fireworks}>>{total_fireworks} fireworks.
